intro: Corydalis hemidicentra, commonly known as the purple corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with a distinctive two-lobed lower lip. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has small, lance-shaped leaves. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae, known for its spurred flowers and often toxic alkaloids.
